citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and in the name and on behalf of the Crown, by this my proclamation made under section 52E of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 –

        (a) dispose of the control of the road specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to the Launceston City Council; and
        (b) dispose of the works specified in that Schedule to the Launceston City Council; and
        (c) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
6 September 1999

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

P. A. LENNON

Minister for Infrastructure, Energy and Resources

SCHEDULE 1 - Description of road and works

Description  Length in kilometres      Glen Dhu Connector, as shown stippled on Plan 4121 in the Central Plan Register, comprising –       (a) that part of Pipeworks Road which connects the Midland Highway with Wellington Street, South Launceston and Glen Dhu Street, Glen Dhu  0.27     (b) that part of Pipeworks Road which provides access to the east of Wellington Street  0.05     (c) the pedestrian underpass and associated footpaths  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 15 September 1999

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
